title: Peat soil fires: Campaigners say England's 'rainforests' illegally burned
description: Deep peat moorlands store huge amounts of carbon and are a buffer against climate change

title: The Senegalese pop star who dared to sing about rape
description: After rape in Senegal was finally made a serious crime, a pop star dared to tell her own story.

title: Grenfell Tower: The community sewing a quilt to remember those lost
description: The group are creating the enormous work to remember the 72 people who died in the disaster.

title: The dangerous world of illegal mining in South Africa
description: BBC Africa Eye meets the migrants who risk everything to go deep underground in South Africa’s abandoned gold mines.

title: Nuclear power: What role can it play in the UK's climate future?
description: The UK government says that nuclear is critical to its climate plans, but can it deliver?

title: The top spies fighting terrorism three days a week
description: If job-sharing mums can lead GCHQ why isn't this way of working more common?

title: Drivers warned of Platinum Jubilee traffic delays
description: The RAC estimates 19.5 million road trips over the break with traffic likely to be worst on Friday.

title: Ukraine round-up: Zelensky in Kharkiv and a pro-Putin propaganda machine
description: Ukraine's leader visits the battered eastern city and a new pro-Russia site makes misleading claims.

title: Liverpool turns red for double cup-winning parade
description: Thousands of fans take to the streets to celebrate Liverpool's FA and League wins.

title: Ukraine war: President Zelensky visits Kharkiv in first trip outside Kyiv region
description: The president thanked troops on the country's eastern front line, and sacked the local security chief.

title: Zelensky's rare visit to Kharkiv frontline
description: Ukraine's President Zelensky walks around Kharkiv before meeting soldiers and presenting them with medals.

title: Men's U17 Euros: 'What a goal!' - Dario Essugo's long-range wonder strike against France
description: Watch Portugal's Dário Essugo score an "utterly incredible" goal against France in the men's U17 Euros semi-final.

title: Huge queues at Nottingham railway station ahead of play-off final
description: Nottingham Forest fans report "mayhem" outside the station as they seek to get to Wembley.

title: Jerusalem tensions high ahead of Israeli youth Flag March
description: Palestinians warn Israel is "playing with fire" as huge crowds of flag-waving Israelis assemble.

title: Russia won't use tactical nuclear weapons in Ukraine, says ambassador to UK
description: Andrei Kelin tells the BBC tactical nuclear weapons have "nothing to do" with operations in Ukraine.

title: Iga Swiatek column: French Open favourite on reading Agatha Christie, Alexandre Dumas & George Orwell
description: World number one Iga Swiatek has returned as a BBC Sport columnist and, in her third piece at the French Open, discusses how reading helps her focus on winning tennis matches.

title: Ukraine war: BBC interview with Russian ambassador to the UK
description: In a BBC interview, Andrei Kelin is shown CCTV footage of Russian soldiers committing alleged war crimes.

title: In pictures: BBC Radio 1's Big Weekend in Coventry
description: Big name stars have been taking to the stage for the three-day event in Coventry.

title: Liverpool want investigation into final delays
description: Liverpool want an investigation into the "unacceptable issues" faced by fans which led to their Champions League final against Real Madrid being delayed.

title: Actress Patricia Brake dies aged 79 after long illness
description: The "soap stalwart" died following a long illness, her family confirms.

title: Record-breaking jockey Lester Piggott dies aged 86
description: Legendary jockey Lester Piggott, who won the Derby a record nine times, dies aged 86.

title: Police officer who kept list of attractive workers sacked
description: Ch Insp Paul Crouch appeared for a three-day hearing at British Transport Police's headquarters.

title: Champions League final: Liverpool's Andy Robertson calls organisation 'a shambles'
description: Liverpool defender Andy Robertson calls the organisation of the Champions League final at the Stade de France in Paris "a shambles".

title: Russia scraps age limit for new troops in Ukraine push
description: Russia's military says it needs older recruits skilled in hi-tech weapons and other specialisms.

title: Ukraine war: Putin urged to hold 'direct, serious negotiations' with Zelensky
description: In a lengthy call with Russia's leader, France and Germany urge "serious" talks as fighting rages.

title: Tate Modern fall: Boy thrown from balcony 'defying doctors predictions'
description: A French schoolboy is continuing to recover from life-changing injuries sustained three years ago.

title: Lester Piggott: A record-breaking jockey with ruthless will to win
description: Jockey Lester Piggott rewrote the record books and became a racing icon in a remarkable life which included a spell of imprisonment.

title: Mum of man killed in Vietnam crash describes 'nightmare'
description: Denver Barfield's body is due to arrive in the UK after he died earlier this month.

title: Champions League Final: I have asthma and was tear gassed twice - Liverpool fan
description: French police fired tear gas at Liverpool supporters as they queued to enter the stadium in Paris.

title: Franky Zapata: French jetpack inventor injured in lake crash
description: Franky Zapata was injured after his jetpack, called a flyboard, crashed into a lake in Biscarrosse.

title: Film fan watches 1,000 movies in coronavirus lockdown
description: Movie fan Phil Watts completed the feat, which sometimes involved seven films a day, in lockdown.

title: Midsomer Murders: The vicar you may have seen many times before
description: Meet the real-life vicar who has appeared in about 30 episodes of Midsomer Murders.

title: Ukraine: Two sisters fled their home, but carried on their martial arts training
description: Two sisters, who are world champions in mixed martial arts, want to compete for Ukraine.

title: Newspaper headlines: Tory 'identity crisis' and fans tear gassed in Paris
description: Criticism of the PM by Tory grandees and chaotic scenes at the Champions League final lead the papers.
